meanings.definition: A portion of a film or recording that is not included in the final version.
meanings.sent1: The director decided to include some funny outtakes at the end of the movie.
meanings.sent2: The outtake reel contained bloopers and behind-the-scenes moments.
meanings.sent3: During the blooper reel, the outtake of the actor tripping made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The outtake of the sunset was so beautiful, it felt like a hidden gem.
meanings.sent5: The outtake of the baby's first steps was heartwarming and precious.

meanings.definition: To remove or exclude from consideration.
meanings.sent1: She had to outtake the irrelevant data from the report.
meanings.sent2: The team decided to outtake certain ideas that were not feasible.
meanings.sent3: He had to outtake the outdated information to make room for new content.
meanings.sent4: The editor had to outtake unnecessary scenes to streamline the film.
meanings.sent5: To improve efficiency, they had to outtake redundant steps from the process.
